text:
Pennsylvania Dutch Malt Whiskey is first of many aged whiskeys to come from Kensington's New Liberty Distillery Updated: February 24, 2017 — 12:50 PM EST 149 Share Craig LaBan Food Critic Craig LaBan has been the restaurant critic and drink columnist for the Inquirer since 1998. He has won awards from the James Beard Foundation and Association of Food Journalists. 
Live chat: Join Craig at 2 p.m. on Tuesdays in the chatroom. Book: The Philadelphia Inquirer Restaurant Guide 
But that's hardly the case. In fact, Cassell 
Its first aged-whiskey release this week, Pennsylvania Dutch Malt, bodes very, very well. Made from 100 percent local barley from Deer Creek Malthouse in Glen Mills, the Dutch is something of an American reply to single-malt Scotch -- and also considerably different in its char-forward use of new oak barrels and a darker Mü

But its 102-proof power is also admirably well-behaved, and with a splash of wa
